description.narrative: (i) Import substitution: Currently, South Africa imports around 20,000 TPA BOPP plain films. The BOPP films produced by this Project will lead to import substitution and eventually facilitate the growth of the local economy. (ii) Job creation: The Project is expected to create more than 200 new jobs during construction and operation. Furthermore, additional jobs will be created through auxiliary services, through the life of the Project. (iii) Environmental and social best practice: A successful implementation of IFC''s Environmental & Social (E&S) standards will serve as an example which other chemical companies might emulate. (iv) Knowledge transfer: SRF''s experience in India and IFC''s technical advice will allow the Sponsor to transfer knowledge of efficient plant management and operations to Africa.

SRF Limited (SRF), a large Indian producer of packaging films, is setting up a greenfield 26,000 ton per annum (TPA) bi-axially oriented polypropylene (BOPP) and 5,700 TPA metallizer plant in Durban, South Africa, to produce packaging films catering to various industries including food production and distribution, at a cost of about US$67 million (Project).
